OWLFactory

public OWLFactory()
Method Detail

createKB

public static final OWLKnowledgeBase createKB()
Create a new and initially empty knowledge base. This method is functionally equivalent to invoking createKB(null).

Returns:
A new initially empty knowledge base.
See Also:
createKB(OWLKnowledgeBaseManager)

createKB

public static final OWLKnowledgeBase createKB(OWLKnowledgeBaseManager manager)
Create a new knowledge base. Initially, its properties are set as follows
  • no reasoner is attached, i.e, OWLKnowledgeBase.getReasoner() returns null,
  • auto consistency is disabled, i.e, OWLKnowledgeBase.isAutoConsistency() returns false,
  • auto translation is disabled, i.e., OWLKnowledgeBase.isAutoTranslate() returns false, and
  • strict conversion is enabled, i.e., OWLKnowledgeBase.isStrictConversion(), returns true.

Parameters:
manager - If null the KB uses the global/default KB manager, i.e., load and caching properties of the associated KB manager are shared by all KB created this way. Otherwise, the created KB will have the behavior as specified by the given KB manager (which may also be shared by multiple KBs).
Returns:
A new initially empty knowledge base.

createKBManager

public static final OWLKnowledgeBaseManager createKBManager()
Create a new knowledge base manager (that can be used by multiple KBs) to adjust load and caching behavior independently from the default/global KB manager.

Returns:
A new knowledge base manager.

createIndividualList

public static final <T extends OWLIndividual> OWLIndividualList<T> createIndividualList()
Type Parameters:
T - The type of OWL individuals the list is supposed to contain.
Returns:
A new and empty individuals list.

createIndividualList

public static final <T extends OWLIndividual> OWLIndividualList<T> createIndividualList(int capacity)
Type Parameters:
T - The type of OWL individuals the list is supposed to contain.
Parameters:
capacity - The initial capacity of the list.
Returns:
A new and empty individuals list with the specified initial capacity.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified initial capacity is negative.

getReasonerNames

public static final java.util.List<java.lang.String> getReasonerNames()
Returns:
A list of unique names of reasoners provided by the backing implementation.

createABoxQueryParser

public static final Parser<java.lang.String,ABoxQuery<Variable>> createABoxQueryParser(OWLModel model,
                                                                                       QueryLanguage lang)
Create a parser that can convert queries of the given query language into ABox queries. The details (formal semantics) of such conversions are up to be defined elsewhere.

Parameters:
model - The model to be queried by the returned ABox query.
lang - The language/syntax of the query.
Returns:
A new ABox query parser.

castList

public static final <T extends OWLIndividual> OWLIndividualList<T> castList(java.util.List<? extends OWLIndividual> list,
                                                                            java.lang.Class<T> castTarget)
Cast all elements of the given list to the target OWL concept and return them in a new list. It can be used whenever it is known that all source elements also represent the target OWL concept.

The order of elements is preserved.

In contrast to wrapList(List, Class) this method reports failed attempts to cast some element into the target concept immediately by throwing a CastingException. For the former throwing this exception is delayed until the first access of some element in the list.

Parameters:
list - The list of elements to be casted.
castTarget - The target OWL concept into which to cast each element.
Returns:
The list of elements, all casted to the target OWL concept.
Throws:
java.lang.AssertionError - If list and/or castTarget is null.
CastingException - If some element does not represent an OWL individual (implicitly or explicitly) of the target concept.

wrapList

public static final <T extends OWLIndividual> CastingList<T> wrapList(java.util.List<? extends OWLIndividual> list,
                                                                      java.lang.Class<T> castTarget)
Wrap all elements of the given list by a list that allows dynamic casting of elements into the target OWL concept, only if they are accessed in the returned list. It can be used whenever it is known that all source elements also represent the target OWL concept.

The order of elements is preserved.

In contrast to castList(List, Class) this method reports failed attempts to cast some element into the target concept only on first access from the returned list (by throwing a CastingException), whereas the former would throw this exception immediately when elements in the source list are casted and added to the parameterized list.

Parameters:
list - The list of elements to be wrapped.
castTarget - The target OWL concept into which to cast each element.
Returns:
A list of all elements that will be casted dynamically into the target OWL concept whenever accessed.
Throws:
java.lang.AssertionError - If list and/or castTarget is null.

emptyIndividualList

public static final <T extends OWLIndividual> OWLIndividualList<T> emptyIndividualList()
Returns:
The empty OWL individual list (immutable).

unmodifiableIndividualList

public static final <T extends OWLIndividual> OWLIndividualList<T> unmodifiableIndividualList(java.util.List<T> list)
Returns an unmodifiable view of the specified list. This method allows to provide users with "read-only" access to lists. Query operations on the returned list "read through" to the specified list, and attempts to modify the returned list, whether direct or via its iterator, result in an UnsupportedOperationException.

Parameters:
list - The list for which an unmodifiable view is to be returned.
Returns:
An unmodifiable view of the specified list.
